titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: William H. Henderson (b. 1910) was secretary of the Division of Vocation of the Board of Christian Education of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. Prior to this appointment he was university pastor and director of the Westminster Foundation at Iowa State University. In 1957, Henderson received a fellowship for a year's study, observation, and participation in student work in Latin America, under joint sponsorship of the Association of Presbyterian University Pastors, the Board of Christian Education, and the Commission on Ecumenical Mission and Relations. He received a B.D. from Yale University.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers and slides from Henderson's trip to Latin America in 1957-1958. Materials include: slides of schools, villages and cities, farms, and people; correspondence between Henderson and missionaries and staff of the Board of Christian Education related to visit planning; itineraries and agendas; reports from Henderson from each country; programs, bulletins from various churches, schools, and hospitals; and travel brochures, informational pamphlets, and maps. There are materials in Spanish, Portuguese, and other languages.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
